page.title: 14 FAMOUS PEOPLE OF FOLKESTONE
page.content: {WILLIAM HARVEY}-born in Church Street in 1578. Known primarily as the discoverer of the circulation of the blood. Undertook important research in reproduction and the study of organs in animal life. {H.G.WELLS}-lived in Sandgate at Spade House for 12 years. He loved Folkestone where he wrote many of his famous books including 'Kipps', 'First Men in the Moon' and 'Mr Polly', which were inspired by his experiences here.Famous literary men such as Henry James, Joseph Conrad and Arnold Bennett were entertained by him. {WILLIAM CUBITT}-brought railways and prosperity to Folkestone in 1843. He built the Foord viaduct using eleven million bricks. He also developed the harbour and built the Pavilion Hotel. {SUSAN SPAIN-DUNK}-famous musician and early conductor of London Proms.
